1311.title: Gardevoir

13111.content:
Ok then!



I was a cold winter night. blizzard out side, power out. I sat next to the fire. My house was a big shack. I got up to shut a window, that was open because yesterday was fairly sunny, I was a freak storm. I tryed as hard as a could. won't buge. I got on warm clothing, and brown boots. and got a hammer. I walked out of my house and made my was around 2-3 feet deep snow. I came around to the frozen window. *Bam* *BAM!* The ice shattered then I proceeded to shut the window. Then I herd a faint whine. "hm?" I walked towards it. Then a saw a gardevoir under a large tree shaking out of cold. "arceus! are you ok?" I said rushing over to her, her body felt like a block of ice! "Come on. I can't leave you out here." I said getting her to her feet. Then I started to walk foward, but she walked very slow. I picked her up, her body had a few icicles on her! I rushed her inside. Taking my coat off and putting it on her and sitting her next to the fire. I then ran to the other room grabing two blankets. I ran and put them around her. "you ok?" I asked her. She nodded seeming to understand me, she was still shaking even in a heavy coat and two blankets plus a fire. I sat there for ten minutes untill she took off the coat and one of the blankets. I was happy to have found her! she would have died! "are you hungry?" I asked. She turned to me very fast. "gard!" She said. I hurried and made a sandwich, gave it to her, then make my own. By the time I was back she had finished it. "woah you were really hungry." I said to her.

(im gonna stop the story here. want it to go fast? or slow? .. love wise.)
13111.title: continue 1 silverlucario ver.

choices: My bed, I'll sleep on the couch
There just happens to be a guest room
131112.content:
"Gard gardevoir." She said smiling at me. She wrapped her arms around me and gave me a hug. I simply returned the hug seeing as though she was thanking me. Then, she broke away and gave me a kiss on my cheek. I didn't know how to react, but all I knew was that my face was probably red. What she was doing next shocked me... she was headed for the door to leave! I looked out the window and the blizzard still hadn't calmed down.

"Wait!" I yelled as I bolted after her. Just before she reached the door handle, I slammed my hand on the door and blocked her way. She looked at me puzzled.

"Voir?"

"I can't let you leave!"

"Gar!" She looked stunned.

"I mean... the blizzard still hasn't settled down. I don't want you to freeze to death like you almost did when I found you." Her expression softened to understanding. She must have thought I was trying to trap her or something. She turned and took a few steps to peer out the same window that I did a moment ago and she saw a flurry of snow pelting the glass as if it was trying to get in. She looked down like she was lost deep in thought. "Is something the matter?" She jumped a tiny bit as I broke her out of her thoughts and she looked at me with a nervous smile.

"Voir..." She looked down again as her smile disappeared. "Gar gar voir gardevoir." I always found it a little irritating that humans couldn't understand what a pokemon was saying besides the hints that come with their expressions.

"Well, you're welcome to stay here until the blizzard lets up if you want." There was a gleam in gardevoir's eyes that told me that she'd appreciate it. "Come on, let's find you a place to sleep. I don't have a pokeball and I'm not just going to simply drop you off onto the couch." I took her hand and for a split second, I could have sworn I saw gardevoir's face turn a slight shade of pink.
131112.title: slow

1311121.content:
Since my house didnt have a guest room (not that I'd be expecting many guests around these parts), I felt it was the right thing to do to allow the Gardevoir to use my bedroom. If she was as blistering cold as I thought she was, my bed would be the warmest place for her. Wouldnt want her getting sick, now would we?

"Ah! Here we are!" I opened the door and led my newest guest into my room, "you'll be sleeping here for the night."
"Gar....?" Gardevoir stared wide-eyed all around my room almost in awe. I gave her space as she walked around my room, looking it up and down, possibly 'basking in its glory' or something silly. "Gaaar... deee...." She stared up at the ceiling fan, down at the soft carpet, peeked into my closet, tilted her head at my tv, she was seriously acting like a curious peasant that stumbled inside a nobleman's castle! It was too cute for words!

As much as I enjoyed the show, I had to show her to the bed.
"Here, over here," I ushered her over to the bed, "you can sleep here."
Gardevoir merely blinked a few times at me like a curious child.
"Sleep," I tried to explain it to her despite the language barrier, "you sleep on it. You lie down on it and go to sleep."
"Vo...ir?" she still wasnt getting the concept. I had to remind myself that I was dealing with a pokemon who has probably never seen human civilization in her life, so I had to be slow with her.

The best way I could describe the use of my bed was by example.
"Watch, watch," I said to her as I hopped into my bed and lied in it, "like this, see? You just lie down..." I pointed to the pillow, "head against the pillow," I rested my head and against the pillow, "then you pull the blanket over," I pulled the blanket over myself, "Like this!" How else was I supposed to explain it to her.

Gardevoir continued to stare wide-eyed, possibly making a mental note that could possibly change her life as she knows it. "Gar... gar de!"
"Hop in," I swayed my hand my way and patted the vacant spot on the bed.
"GaAR?!" Gardevoir was suddenly shocked at the notion. Dont ask me why.
"It's ok," I assured her, "it's comfy and warm. C'mon. Hop in."

Gardevoir seemed a bit hesitant judging by her worried expression as she poked at the bed, but she finally caved and hopped in next to me. The moment Gardevoir lied down with me, she began to get used to it fast!
"Gar... gar de voir.... Gardevoir!" an excited smile appeared on her face as she said with glee, "Gardevoir! Garde voir! Gar! De!" She practically rolled around in joy cuz of how incredibly comfortable my bed was. "Ga ha har de voir! Ga ha ha!!"
I kinda laughed myself at how overly excited she was over the bed. I can imagine this was probably the most comfortable thing she's ever slept on in her life!

"Like the bed?"
"Ga-ar!!" I took that as a yes.
"If you think that's great, here!" I pulled the blanket over her. She gasped at first, but then let out a relaxed sighed and gripped the covers tightly. Gardevoir was clearly satisfied. With that out of the way, I was ready to hurry off to MY new sleeping spot of the night: the couch.

But just when I was about to walk out, Gardevoir suddenly got up and looked over at me.
"Gar? Gar de!" Gardevoir was staring at me questionably. "Gardevoir! Voir!" Then she swayed her arms her way and patted the vacant spot on the bed! Once again I started to blush at that generous offer!

"Er... thanks," I said, "but's it... um... kind of... improper that we both share a bed."
"De?" she seemed disappointed.
"Dont worry about me. I'm gonna go sleep on the couch," I said to her with a smile, "er... let me know if you have any trouble sleeping. Good night, Gardevoir!"
The graceful psychic pokemon smiled back at me "Gardevoir!" I noticed her glow a bright multiple shade of colors as she puckered her lips and made a quick smooching sound.

"!!" I jumped in surprise as I felt a ghost's lips press against my cheek! It wasnt a ghost, though. I could tell by the way Gardevoir's cheeks went pink again, she had something to do with it. A psychic kiss. Cool! If she can deliver a kiss telepathically, a pervy part of my brain began to wonder what other kind of nifty tricks she can do telepathically!
I immediately walked out of the room before Gardevoir could see any of those thoughts I was having!

I thought about what to do with her tomorrow as I headed to the living room. Since I wasnt a pokemon trainer, I couldnt capture her. Besides, how do I know she doesnt have family of her own out there? She could possibly have a husband/boyfriend/mate out there probably looking all over for her... not to mention, she could have baby Ralts wondering where their mommy went. I'd feel guilty if I kept her locked up in my house. Yet, cuz of this snowstorm, I couldnt just risk having her freeze to death! There's just so many questions I wanna ask her in the morning, but I cant talk to a pokemon.

As I lied down on the couch, I just thought, 'You know what? I'll worry about all that crap after the blizzard stops.' And that's just what I intended to do! I pulled my extra blanket over me, curled up tight and went straight to sleep...

The next morning...
1311121.title: I made my bed... and I'm gonna lie in it!

choices: Let her sleep and go make breakfast
Wake her up and say good morning
13111211.content: I awoke to the sun's bright and warming light shining through the window. At the same moment, I had wondered if Gardevoir was an early riser and decided to leave without saying goodbye. So, I got up and went to my room where she slept for the night. I knocked on the door, but there wasn't a sound to be heard after that. I carefully opened the door quietly and looked inside. I was glad to see that she was simply still sound asleep. It was only after I had opened the door that I could hear her breathing. I felt happy... happy that I found her. She looked so peaceful...
13111211.title: ...the blizzard stops!

131112111.content:
There's two perfectly good explanations why I didnt wake her up right then and there. One was because she looked so peaceful, like she hadnt had a good sleep in a LONG time. And two... because she's a high-leveled psychic pokemon. It is very dangerous to wake a psychic pokemon up from a deep sleep mainly because if she gets startled, that brief moment of mental imbalance could cause unintended harm to my brain. Surprised the lot of you pokemon trainers didnt know that!

So I let sleeping pokemon lie and to the kitchen and made breakfast. I wasnt exactly a chef, so my choices to make were pretty limited. At the least I had plenty of waffles. So I microw-I mean, cooked a couple of waffles, put some butter and maple syrup on them, poured some juice in two glasses, and waited to see if my new Gardevoir friend would come down and join me. Heck if I know she'd like what waffles, but there's only one way to find out.

"Gaa...rr?" and right on cue, I heard the sound of her adorable curious voice call out. To me it sounded like she was calling my name. Not sure if she even knew my name to begin with.
"Good morning, Gardevoir!" I said with a bright smile.
"Ga haar-de!" she said with an equally bright smile as she hovered toward me.
Like the gentlemen I was, I pulled a chair out for her. "Have a seat." She merely tilted her head, so once again, I had to show her. "Like this." I sat in my seat.

"De..." she observed her own chair for a moment before finally sitting in it, "...de."
"I made breakfast." Then I set her plate of waffles down along her knife and fork and glass of juice. Once again, she acted like a curious peasant.
"Voir?" she leaned in toward her plate, eyeing the waffles on it, even sniffing it a bit.
"It's waffles," I explained to her as if it even mattered. She just stared as I cut up my waffle slice with a knife, poked a piece with a fork, and ate it.

Gardevoir then stared back at her own plate. At first she attempted to grasp her fork and knife, but to no avail. I'm guessing cuz it's hard to grasp utensils with only three fingers.
"Gaaa...." she made a voice that sound similar to a girly whine. Then she realized, 'You know what? I'm a freaking PSYCHIC!' and used her mental powers to levitate the knife to cut a slice off her waffle, then the fork to pick it and send it to her mouth.
It wasnt long before she stopped using the fork and knife and just snatched the other waffles off the plate and scarf them down! Man, she musta been hungry. Either that or I was a really good microwaver-I mean cook!

"Aaa... garde..." after finishing her breakfast, Gardevoir sighed and lied back, rubbing her tummy in satisfaction. Sheesh, that was a smorgasbord to her?!
"Enjoyed it?"
"Gardevoir!" she announced with glee. After washing it down with juice, the time had come. As much as I didnt want her to leave so soon, she probably had family out there waiting for her. I really hoped I didnt cause her any trouble keeping her here.

Just as soon as we stepped outside, Gardevoir's eyes brightened.

"Gar!! Gar de voir!! GAR DE!!" she shouted with joy. It was obvious she was overjoyed that the blizzard stopped. She sang and danced about, probably savoring in the nice refreshing warmth of this delightful spring day.
"GAAAAA-ar?" she suddenly stopped singing and stared over at me. Her blissful smile then changed to a frown. I knew what this meant and so did she. Goodbye.

"Gar. Gar de gar de voir," she spoke to me and bowed her head, probably thanking me for providing her shelter.
"It was no problem at all," I assured regardless of whether or not she could understand me, "I was happy to help. Besides..." my own face went red, "it was nice to finally have a visitor at my place."
She tilted her head, closed her eyes, and gave me a heartwarming smile that made me feel warm and fuzzy inside! "Gaaaaardevoir!"

"Goodbye, Gardevoir," I said my goodbye, "if you ever need shelter, youre more than welcome to come back!"
And with that, she turned around and walked off toward the forest. Immediately, I began to miss her. She was the only decent company I had in a while.

*smooch!*

"!!" once more, I felt a pair of familiar invisible lips pressed against my cheek! Somehow I was quick to recognize the sensation of those lips! Gardevoir turned her head back to me and gave me one last smile before blowing me another kiss.

*smooch!*

I shivered in glee at the sensation that last ghost kiss felt. So warm, so tingly, so soothing. Seriously, her psychic kisses were amazing! I had to constantly remind myself that she was a pokemon to fight those feelings off before I end up being entranced by them!

As I struggled with that brief moment of bliss Gardevoir finally turned around and continued her walk.

*Smooch Smooch Smooch Smooch!*

And suddenly I felt myself smothered in those irresistable ghost-kisses! I was easily overpowered by the bliss of those luscious tingly invisible lips! Any more and I'd have probably have fallen to the ground writhing in the pleasure of the psychic-smooches! Just when I couldnt get enough of it, Gardevoir finally left my field of vision, taking all her smooches with her.

"W... wow..." I muttered, "...what a woman." Suffice to say, it was one heck of a reward for my good deed!
Immediately after she left, I began to miss her. And those magic kisses of hers. I don’t care if she’s a pokemon, anyone would kill to get kisses like THAT! Perhaps there was some kind of a drug laced to them, because I just couldn’t get enough of it!

Not to mention, I rarely have guests over at my house. It gets pretty lonely here. And all the other pokemon I’ve seen around these parts would sooner tear me to shreds than politely accept my generosity!

I sighed hard as I headed back inside, but just as I was about to open my front door, I got to thinking.
I looked back toward the direction that Gardevoir headed. Well, to get to the point, I was bored, curious, and wanted to see her again. Maybe at least find out if her and her family (if she had one) lived nearby. Scratch a little itch, if you get what I’m saying.

Then I shook my head, thinking about how dumb an idea that was. She’s a pokemon and she might already has her own habitat to live in. Not to mention that if she does, the others of her kind might not treat me as well as she did. Heck, they would clearly treat me as an intruder, since I would be!

Still, those kisses did kinda get to me. And I didn’t wanna stay cooped up in my lonesome house the whole time. A little adventure never hurt nobody right? If the average pokemon trainer can handle it, surely I can, right?!
131112111.title: Kisses are Super Effective!

1311121111.content:
I head inside feeling a pang of regret to say such a short goodbye. I couldn't stop thinking about her for so long. I tried taking a shower, watching television, even making my bed that she had slept in last night. However, I still couldn't stop thinking about her. I wondered if I really should have followed her. Soon, I heard a noise from outside. "Gardevoir?" I wondered as I walked to the door. However, as soon as I opened it, it wasn't her. In fact, I didn't see anyone at the door. At least, not at first.

"LADE!" A gallade burst in and shoved me aside sending me flying to the floor.

"Hey! What's the big idea!?" I scream but he didn't seem to respond. Instead, he had disappeared up the stairs in a flash of white and green and I could hear things being tossed and thrown about up there. "Who the heck do you think you are!? Get out!" Gallade rushed back down as if searching for something and turned to me with an angry look and narrowed his eyes. He walked up to me, grabbed my shirt, lifted me up off the ground, and slammed me against the wall.

"GAL GALLADE!?" He seemed to be demanding for something but I didn't know what.

"I'm sorry, I don't seem to understand because I'm a human and YOU'RE A FREAKIN' GALLADE!" He narrowed his eyes even more and tightened his grip on my shirt. What happened next kinda startled me.

"I know she was here!" He was using telepathy! I shouldn't be surprised since he was part psychic type. "I'll ask again... WHERE IS SHE!?" He took me off the wall and slammed me on the ground knocking the breath out of me.

"W-well... excuse me for asking... who is 'she' exactly?" As if I didn't know. I just hoped he wasn't talking about Gardevoir.

"I can tell she was here. Don't try to hide it from me you filthy human! You kidnapped her during the storm!"

"That doesn't answer my question Gallade."

"You know who I'm talking about... Gardevoir! WHERE IS SHE!!!"
1311121111.title: Just head back inside.

13111211111.content:
I didnt wanna cause any more trouble that I already have (inadvertently, that is!) And even if I lied, I'm sure that mohawked dickhead would see through with his telepathy. So since I was in shite creek without a paddle anyways, I figured I might as well tell him.

"I dont know WHICH Gardevoir you might be referring to," I said, "but I didnt kidnap anyone! I did however give warmth and shelter to a Gardevoir during the blizzard. I found her nearly freezing to death under a tree, so I carried her here and offered her food, shelter, and a place to sleep until the bad weather died down."

Fortunately, that was enough for the overzealous Gallade to finally release his grip on me, but then he started looking all around shouting, "GALL! GALLADE!! GAL-LAAADE!!" It looked as though he was calling out to her.
"Where are you holding her, you despicable hairless mankey?!" I heard his equally overzealous voice shout to me in my head.

"I'm not holding her anywhere, cow-lick!" I snapped back, nearly forgetting doing so was not good for my health, "She left after the storm finally died down. She wanted to leave, I let her leave." I left out the parts about her kissing me (physically and psychically). Although I'm not sure whether or not he could probably read those memories in my head as well. But even if he did, I have no reason to feel guilty! SHE kissed ME, I didnt kiss HER! Oy, why am I still on this?!

Anyways, Gallade squinted his eyes as he glared right into mine. I merely glared back. We glared at one another for almost a whole minute before the Gallade finally FINALLY lowered his guard a little. He was still hostile, but not AS hostile as before.

"Did she say where she was going?" Gallade asked.

"I dont know," I honestly said, "I dont speak Pokemon and she never spoke to me telepathically like you did." Maybe certain telepathic skills vary depending on the individual user. After all, not all Gardevoir have the set moveset!
"So you just let her leave all by her lonesome without even finding out where or why?!"
"Well, what else was I supposed to do?! Keep her here against her will?!" I couldnt believe I was explaining myself to a friggin pokemon, "what wouldve happened if you busted in and saw her here with me?!"
"I would have gouged both your eyeballs out with my elbow-blades." Holy crap, he was brutally honest!

"Gaaaa...llllaaaaa..." Gallade let out a loud groan of irritation. Perhaps he had finally come to realize that I'm not the bad guy?
The Gallade turned his head toward outside and stared for a couple of seconds... then he turned his head to me and started saying "Gallade! Gall gallade! GALL!"

"Uh, again. Cant understand you," I repeated.

"I'm holding you equally responsible for her disappearance!" jerk had the nerve to declare, "it is your responsibility to help me find her!" If he werent a wild psychic potential powerhouse, normally I'd tell him to get lost... but since I personally was interested in seeing Gardevoir again, I made no objection. I just hoped she's alright, wherever she is. "I'm sure she couldnt have gotten far. Most of the paths are still blocked by snow. Urgh... god, this place is too cold! What were we thinking coming here?!"

So they didnt live locally, huh? That's understandable. The Ralts family isnt common around THIS part of the world. But I couldnt help but wonder what they were doing here instead of in a much warmer climate?

...Actually you know what I was REALLY wondering? What is this Gallade's relationship to that Gardevoir with those magical smooches?
Er, sure it didnt really matter what his relationship was, but I was still curious! After all, he seems so darn protective of her.

"Ok, ok I'll help you out. Relax," I said to him, "but first, could you even tell me what youre doing here to begin with? And what was that Gardevoir to you? She a friend of yours or something?" That was the best way I could ask what his relationship was to her without looking shady!

And thankfully, it was enough to get the answer I totally wasnt THAT desperate to find out.

"Isnt it obvious?!" Gallade said in your mind, "she's my-"
13111211111.title: I Got Nothing to Hide!

choices: Nope she is asleep next to DARKRAI
131112111111.content:
"She was your Sister?!" "Yes you fool! How could you have just let her run off like that!" "Hey I wasn't going to keep her against her will! I know which direction she headed though..." You then proceed to point towards the open area. "Over there?" "Well yeah she turned back towards me smiled and then walked away."

"Your coming with me to help me find her!" "I had already said I would, I don't go back on my word." "Let's just go!" You silently follow him through the white frosty terrain. As he stops to look at the ground he then senses that she was hear not to long ago. "She was her not too long ago." And with that you both begin to walk through the terrain yet again.

As you soon feel a presence of something you tap his shoulder "What I felt something, I don't quite know what it was it seemed to belong to a Psychic Type might be hers." "Which direction simpleton!" You feel it again and feel it to your right. "Down that way." "Down there, but it is supposed to be abandoned except for a monster!"

You ask "What kind of monster?" "It is supposed to be a pokemon that brings nightmares to any that are sleeping bye it." "Hang on that sounds like I have heard it before! It sounds like... DARKRAI!" Fear actually appears in his eyes he grabs you and breaks into a full run. You run as fast as you could and thankfully you were athletic somewhat. You sense the feeling to the left now. You pull back.

"What now!" "The presence is coming that way now!" He sighs and decides to focus and soon he says "Yes indeed it is her presence. I hope she hasn't met the beast you call DARKRAI." "Me too I never liked the idea of it as it was always used to scare little children." As you both run you are soon in a large clearing with gardevoire.

But... is she alone?"
131112111111.title: "-sister!"

1311121111111.content:
YES! I could see her standing all by her lonesome. No creepy digimon, no ominous shadow or dark aura or anything like that. Gardevoir was safe. Still, I couldnt help but continue looking over my shoulder. Sure, I've never seen Darkrai around these parts before, but if a Gardevoir and a Gallade are here, who knows who else decided to tread on my territory recently!
"Gardevoir!"
"GALLADE!" both me and the Gallade called out to her (him obviously in more of a panic than me)

"Ga?!" Gardevoir immediately turned around and faced us. I held back the urge to feel all warm and tingly seeing her again.
"Gardevoir!" I felt her smiling my way as she ran toward me! I could not hold back the urge to feel all warm and tingly anymore! I extended my arms ready to give her a nice big warm hug!

"Gallade!!" unfortunately, Gallade dashed in front of me and gave Gardevoir that friggin hug that she was supposed to be getting from me! I didnt really know why I was feeling jealous all of a sudden. I shouldve felt relieved and prideful that I just reunited a brother and sister!

Finally after the hug ended, Gallade began to converse with his sister!
"Gallade! Ga gal gallde?! Gal al all gal?!" I couldnt understand what he was saying, but judging by his panicked expressions, he was probably asking her if she was alright and why she wandered off on her own.
"Ga-ard? Gard de voir!" she apparently answered him, "Voir de gar. Garr."
"Gaaaall! Ade!!"
"Gar ar arde!"

I was currently feeling like the odd one out. Gallade didnt so much as give me a telepathic translation of their conversation. But I'm certain they were bringing up me in their chat a few times judging by the way Gallade and Gardevoir turned her heads to me a few times. Every time she turned her head to me, it seemed warmed and inviting while every time Gallade turned his head to me, it seemed cold and hostile!

Realizing that I was way too interested for my own good, I returned my attention to the surroundings. There was still nothing out of the ordinary, but I had to keep my guard up. For all I knew, Darkrai was probably giving us a false sense of security before knocking us out when we least suspect it and devouring our dreams!

Before I knew it, Gallade grabbed Gardevoir's arm and began dashing off! Geez, jerk didnt even bother to warn me that they were leaving! Nonetheless, I ran along with them trying to keep up.
Fortunately for us, we made it out of that abandoned frosty wasteland without a single Darkrai in sight. Guess the whole 'Darkrai' schtick was just a silly children's horror story after all.
All three of us stared at one another for almost a whole moment as a light cool breeze blown across us. I was getting awful sick of the silence myself. I was waiting for Gallade to say or think anything. After all, he hasnt properly thanked me for helping him find his sister (not to mention providing her warmth and shelter!)

"Gal!" he FINALLY broke the silence, but only to speak to his sister, "Gallade. Gallade!"
"Gaarr..." Gardevoir gave a slightly timid nod. And just like that, the two turned around and walked off. Not even a thank you!

By the time the two of them were out of view, I gave a harsh shrug and thought, 'YOURE WELCOME, JERK!' I sighed hard and shook my head.

*Smooch!*

And flinched a bit when I felt those ghostly lips press against my cheek again! My face went flush yet again from her psychic smooch. Well, at least SHE was grateful! And to be honest, that was pretty much all I cared about! And with that crisis averted, I headed back home with a smile on my face and partially lonesome... still missing my friend.
Well, it was a pretty lively day, but I felt pretty much out of it and should probably head back home for the rest of it. So, I retraced my steps, followed the path me and Gallade took, but reversing it, and before I knew it...

...I was still wandering the snow-covered forest. Odd. Judging by the directions and length of time we took, I shoulda been back home by now. Once again, I looked for a familiar path and continued retracing my steps.
It was no good. I still found myself in the middle of the snow-covered forest. Curious, I went as far as following Gallade's footprints in the snow. After a while of pointless walking leading to nowhere, I had come to the realization that I was walking in circles!

"Ok, this is weird," I admitted out loud, "it shouldnt be this difficult retracing steps! I mean it's not like the paths magically change on their own!" ...Do they?
No soon after did I notice that the sky was a dusky red. I wasnt wandering around that long! I've only been out for about a hour during the afternoon! How could it be dusk so soon?!
Even after a few minutes of walking around hopelessly, the dusky sky blackened to a starlit night!
"Oh c'mon!" I actually blurted out loud as I stared at my watch, "it's only 2pm! What's going on-!!"

I suddenly felt a cool breeze chill the back of my neck. Not like the wind. More like somebody literally blowing on my neck! I turned around and lo and behold, nobody was there! As if I wasnt paranoid enough, I could feel another presence around me. Something or someone was watching me. Maybe it was an animal instinct telling me this, but I did not like the presence. Something was telling me to stay away; to keep as far away from it as possible. Too bad that was a lot easier said than done!

"HELLO?" I shouted out, "IS SOMEBODY THERE?!" No response. But I knew somebody was there! "I KNOW YOURE OUT THERE! SHOW YOURSELF!" Still nothing. Somebody was playing a joke on me!

I continued to feel the cooling chill blow around me. I shivered a bit as I kept pacing around under the starlit sky. Little did I know that cooling chill had another side-effect. The longer I paced around in the chilling wind, the weaker I gotten. My walking slowed, my breathing got heavier, and I was having trouble keeping my eyelids open. I was feeling very tired all of a sudden. My body felt like it hadnt slept in days! Whoever was out there, it had just sapped up all my energy.

The part of me that wasnt feeling tired was starting to worry. That part of me was telling the rest of my body to wake up and start panicking, but the rest of my body wasnt hearing any of that!

"Dont strain yourself..." I heard a pleasant voice whisper in my ear, "lie down... take a rest..."
"Lie down..." my own mouth repeated in agreement, "...take a rest..."

Through my barely opened eyes, I made out a big luxurious bed in the middle of nowhere. It looked brand new and very neatly made. My brain was too out of it to question what a bed was doing in the middle of nowhere. All it was thinking was 'PERFECT TIMING'.

"Lie down here..." the voice whispered, "it's so nice... and warm here...."
It felt like my feet were moving on my own, heading toward that bed to take a nice little nap... that for all I know, I probably wouldnt wake from!
As I got closer, I could make out another figure lying on that bed, waiting. I couldnt see it very clearly, but I was able to make out the figure of a white haired woman in a black tattered gothica dress with what looked like a red scarf around her neck. Despite being unable to see her face, her bright blue eyes shined very clearly even through my spaced out vision. Her eyes probably helped draw me closer.

"Sleep..." the voice whispered as I headed closer to that bed, "sleep..."
1311121111111.title: One, Two.... Freddy's Coming For You.

13111211112.content:
The Gallade was hostile. Very hostile. So unlike that cute Gardevoir who was very friendly and didnt talk and gave me lots of kisses. He also seemed incredibly quick to jump to conclusions. I figured that if I told him the truth, he'd automatically assume I was trying to take advantage of that Gardevoir friend/sister/girlfriend/wife/mother/daughter/whatever of his and probably tear me to pieces with his elbow-blades.

Sure he was part psychic, but he was also part fighting, so hopefully the PSYCHIC part of him isnt able to read minds! Especially the one about how I'm really really REALLY that Gardevoir's tele-smooches!

"I dont know what youre talking about," I lied.

"What do you mean you dont know?!" His cold glare of disbelief matched the voice I heard in my head.

"I dont know of any Gardevoir," I answered, "I have never seen a single Garevoir since I first started living here. I know this place aint exactly a safe breeding ground for Ralts. I'm still dumbstruck that I'm standing here talking to a Gallade of all things!" The angry Gallade squinted his angry eyes at me. "Er, no offense."
I waited patiently for his response, but I was not liking the stare his giving me.

You know the kind of stare. That silent but artic cold chilling staredown kind of stare that you see in those detective movies during an interrogation when the detective guy sees through the suspect's bullshit and just silently waits until the suspect suddenly cracks and confesses the whole thing?

THAT kind of stare!

"Gall..." he silently grunted. Danged if I knew what that meant. After almost a whole minute and a half of staring silently with the front door left wide open causing me to freeze my ass off, I finally heard a telepathic response.

"So you've NEVER seen a Gardevoir here?" he questioned, "Ever?"

I shook my head, "No never."

He continued staring me in the eye. "Not even once?"

"N-not even once." I answered. Sweat dripped down my forehead. Was he buying it? Am I finally clear to go... I mean is HE finally clear to go?!

He nodded. I breathed a sigh of relief...

...right before being sent flying and smacking straight into the kitchen table, shattering it on impact! Pain enveloped me. I think I mighta bruised a few ribs, but I was still in a daze from the sudden psychic G-force that sent me flying to concern myself with pain! If I had to make an educated guess, I'd say he didnt buy it. Nope not a bit. Shoulda known Gallades werent stupid. Now I learned the hard way that they were smart AND strong!

After the dizziness died so, I focused more attention to how much I was hurting at the moment! I'm pretty sure I pulled something from the impact, but I'd rather not get into detail what! How I wished Gardevoir was here to psychic-kiss all these booboos and make them all better.

Speaking of which, I saw Gallade charging at me at mach speed! You bet your ass he wasnt done with me yet!
Next thing I remember was that he was standing over me with his razor sharp elbow-blade pointed at my throat. Man if looks could kill, he wouldnt need that elbow-blade to tear my throat open!

"Gall Gal ade. Gaaaa," his voice was intimidatingly cold and I had to lie there and wait for the telepathic translation.

"I will ask you just one last time, human." the voice spoke calmly just before Gallade leaned down close to my face.

And roared, "GAAAAAALLADE??!!!!"
"WHERE IS SHE?!!!"
13111211112.title: Dont need to be a psychic to see this coming...

131112112.content:
As peaceful as she looked while asleep, it was probably for the best that I woke her up. It was an extreme, but what if she did have family looking for her? I imagined how awkward it would be if they found her sleeping in my bed. If she had a boyfriend/husband... well, use YOUR imagination. Besides, I'm not a pokemon trainer and I'd rather not be fined if word got out I was illegally housing a wild pokemon without a license.

It made me feel bad waking Gardevoir, seeing her curling up in my blanket basking in it's warmth, no doubt having a good dream.

I gently shook her a little, being extra careful not to spook her. You NEVER wanna spook a high-leveled pokemon that specializes in psychic powers!

"G....gar...." fortunately for me, she slowly woke up with no hassle. She stretched a little, let out a yawn, and rubbed her eyes. It mustve been the best sleep she had in a long while, huh?
After her red eyes focused, she drew her attention to me and gave me the world's brightest smile!

"Gardevoir!" she immediately hugged me! Gosh, I nearly zoned out from the hug she was giving me! It felt so warm and snuggly! The red protrusion in her chest wasnt bothering me one bit. No wonder Gardevoirs are 'embracing' pokemon!
I smiled nervously and hugged her back, "Good morning, Gardevoir. Guess you slept well?" I really didnt want her to let go of me, but she unfortunately did. I missed it almost as much as her psychic-kiss!
"Garde!" she announced with utter excitement, "gar gar de! Gar!" Wow was she pretty up and at'em this morning. That's good. She shouldnt have much trouble heading home. Not that I was in any hurry to let her leave, though.

"You must be hungry, huh?" I asked her. She just tilted her head, still smiling a cute smile, "I'll make us some breakfast in a little bit. First, I'm gonna go take a quick shower."
"Gar gardevoir!" she beamed again. Shame I couldnt understand what she was saying.
"I wont be long, I promise!" I assured her.

"Gaaar de! Gardevoir!" *smooch!* I jumped again from the ghostly kiss on my cheek! Part of me deep down was screaming 'YES! YES! SHE KISSED ME AGAIN!' while I tried my best to keep a cool face, despite my blushing.
"Heheheh," I laughed nervously, "Uh..." I returned the favor and blew her a kiss, even though she wont feel it!
"Ga ha har!" she giggled. I certainly hope she didnt take that the wrong way...

Anyways, I headed to my bathroom, took off my clothes, and ran the hot water, basking in the ambiance under the shower head. The warm water felt really good against my freezing cold skin. After a blistering cold night, it was refreshing to be in a nice hot shower. I took my time savoring before I finally rubbed some shampoo in my hair until it lathered up nice and reached for the soap.

"Whoops," stupid soap slipped out of my fingers. Dont you just hate it when that happens?

Suddenly, the soap's fall stopped short just before hitting the shower floor! It was actually hovering in mid-air! I could see a glowing aura brighten around it as it somehow floated right back up to me! I raised my eyebrow and dropped my jaw in absolute dumbstruck at the magic trick.

"Garde?"

"Thank you, Gardevoir... GARDEVOIR?!" I jumped and lost my footing and almost slipped after seeing Gardevoir standing right in front of me in the shower! It was nerve wrecking and embarrassing to say the least! Ya know, being naked in a shower with the lady and all... even if said lady was a pokemon!

"Gar de gard!" she continued smiling at me like it was nothing.

"G-G-Gardevoir!" my face went red and used my hands to cover my special spot, "y-youre not supposed to be in here! This is... kinda private!"
"Gar ar de?" Gardevoir tilted her head.
"Um... I'm naked?"
"Gar?"
...Oh right. Why would it matter to her? She's technically naked too, despite the 'dress'.

"Gaaarr..." she turned her attention from me to the shower head. She actually hovered under it and twirled around in the warm 'rain'!

"GA HAAAA!!!" she shouted with utter excitement, spinning about, probably savoring the warm as I was! I snickered a little and shook my head, and resumed washing myself while she was uh, 'busy'.

"Ga ardevoir?" she then stopped spinning and turned her attention to me again, "Ga arde! Gar de! Voir!"
Sadly, I had absolutely no clue what she was going on about. But whatever it was mustve been important to her.
"Um... uh..." didnt know what to say. I really REALLY wished I was a pokemon trainer. Or at least I really REALLY wished she could just speak to me telepathically!

That's when I noticed she grabbed an extra bar of soap. "Gaa ar!" She constantly pointed to me. "Gaa ar!"
I just shrugged my arms and turned away.

"!!" then she began rubbing the bar of soap against my back! Somehow, I didnt flinch out of surprise or anything. I just stood there remaining all cool while she got my back all nice and sudsy. How thoughtful of her. Heck of a way to bond with a total stranger.
“Ga hahahar!!” she laughed happily like an super excited new wife that’s showering with her husband for the very first time. Oh dear. That probably wasn’t a good comparison.
Despite her eagerness, I closed my eyes and tried to relax as I humored her, letting her constantly rub soap against my back!

Her uh… ‘hands’ were soft, but they were incredibly rough on my skin what with her practically slapping soap on me instead of rubbing. But at least she was enjoying it. That was enough for me, I guess.

“Gar de voir!” her washing finally ended. I guess that was her way of saying ’All done!’
“Er, thanks,” I properly thanked her, hoping her mate never ever EVER finds this out… if she has one!

She smiled and turned around. “Gar de! Gar de!” Then she pointed to her own back.
“Huh?” I tilted my head, unable to comprehend what she was saying to me.
“Gar! De!” she pointed to my bar of soap then to her back. …OH!

She wants ME to wash HER back? I uh… didnt know if I should find it cute or awkward. Assuming the worst, my face went red, finding it awkward. Sure, she gleefully washed MY back with no hassle or care, but I’m not nearly as carefree as she is! Pokemon or not, part of me still felt rather shy being naked in a shower with a female stranger! Especially a female EMBRACING stranger!

“Gar de?” She looked over her shoulder at me with a questioned frown, “Gar de voir?”
131112112.title: GAAAAAAARD morning, everybody!

1311121121.content:
I was overthinking this. WAY overthinking this. Overthinking times infinity plus one no take backs! She's just a pokemon. A POKEMON! An animal that can be zapped into a tiny ball that fits in your pocket! It's probably not uncommon that other trainers have showered with their pokemon! Theyre practically pets! ...Nevermind I wasnt a trainer and Gardevoir wasnt a pet.

Now that I forced THAT train of thought through my head and kicked out the whole taboo vibes, I sighed partially relieved and told her, "Hold still." Possibly sensing I'm finally cooled down (despite being warmed in a hot shower), Gardevoir smiled and turned her head back forward.
I lathered up my hands with as much as the soap as I could, not sure how much would be too much for a Gardevoir's skin, and gently rubbed her back.

"Ga ha hah," Gardevoir giggled as I ran my soapy hands up and down her back. She got a bit squeamish when I was cleaning her sides. She mustve been ticklish. She relaxed though after I started rubbing her shoulders. Bear in mind, it wasnt necessary, but I somehow felt obligated to give her a light shoulder rub perhaps to ease the tension she had when she was out in the blistering cold all by her lonesome.

"Deee...." she sighed, pleased by my rubbing. Dont ask me why, but I couldnt stop there. I stopped focusing on scrubbing and just concentrated on giving her a nice massage. I thoroughly rubbed her shoulderblades with my thumbs in a rhythmic pattern, hoping to de-stiffen those aching spots that somehow I knew she had.
Gardevoir was twitching, but she gave me no hint to stop.

Now the next part... well, I'm still unsure how I knew, because I dont really know much about the body of a Gardevoir, but I sensed the most tension coming from the back of that big red protrusion sticking out of her dorsal region. I'm still not sure what the protrusion is nor what it does if it even has a use, but some dumb part of me was telling me to massage it.
"G-G-GARRR?!!!" she immediately jumped and flinched as soon as I pressed my fingers deep into that protrusion piece! I quickly thought 'Uh oh! Was that a bad touch?!' I was pretty nervous, because I had no idea what that meant. It just didnt seem like a good reaction. Worst case scenario, it was sexual harassment!

But instead of reaction any further (let alone psychically beating my ass for touching her where I shouldnt), she simply got a little flustered, but didnt seem resistant. Against my better judgement, I assumed she didnt want me to stop. So again, I was pressing my finger into the red protrusion.

"G-G-Garrrrr.... d-deeeee...." she was shivering, even gritting her teeth, but she still wasnt resisting. She could easily push me away, maybe send me flying across the room with a single thought, but she did none of that. Interesting. The protrusion itself felt incredibly firm, but not hard. I could pinch my fingers deep into it's 'flesh' and it would always regain it's shape rather quickly. Like the memory foam in my mattress!

It wasnt until I noticed she was panting awful heavily before I finally decided to stop. I er, think I overdid it a little.

"O-o-ok!" I finally stopped, trying to hide the blush on my face, "there! N-nice and clean!"

"Vore? De?" she quickly turned around facing me... I couldnt un-notice the rather intrigued look in her eyes as she stared at me. Whatever I did, something told me I passed the point of no return.
"Uh, shower's over!" I quickly dashed to the shower knob and turned off the shower, trying to ignore the intrigued stare she was giving me. I also tried to ignore her stare as I put on my clothes... I ESPECIALLY tried to ignore her stare as I was bending over to pick up my clothes!
"C'mon!" I put on a nervous smile, "let's go get breakfast!" I dashed out of the bathroom and she dashed along with me. I still felt her intrigued stare as I made my way to the kitchen.

So I searched through the fridge for a few bites to eat while Gardevoir was keeping her eyes on me for some odd reason. I thought about whipping up some pancakes or bacon and eggs. Unfortunately I was out of eggs. And bacon. And butter. And milk. And pancake mix. Good lord, I forgot to buy groceries before the stupid storm! Urggh. Perfect timing, yes?

“Gar de?” my intrigued companion tilted her head, sensing my uneasiness (THIS uneasiness, anyway!). I knew the damn storm was coming! I told myself to prepare for it. I told myself repeatedly “GO TO THE SUPERMARKET! GET GROCERIES BEFORE IT STARTS! OR YOU WILL REGRET IT!”
Well I didnt. And I do regret it.

On the plus side, I had an unopened box of Pop Tarts hidden in the corner of a food cabinet. Sigh, that is not breakfast! That's vitamin candy!

I turned my head to Gardevoir actually considering it. I mean, she's just a pokemon. It's not like she's got an expensive palate or anything.
But the moral side of me told myself not to be stingy. It was actually telling me to head outside in the storm and get more groceries! IN THE STORM, can you believe it?!

That side of me did nag pretty hard. It made me hesitant to open the box of Pop Tarts and call it breakfast. I looked out the window. It wasnt snowing as bad as last night, but still...
1311121121.title: Scrubbing Those Hard To Reach Places

choices: Try to learn a bit more about each other.
Go and get that grocery shopping done.
13111211211.content:
As much as I wished I could whip up a classy breakfast for the Gardevoir, I didn't want to trudge through all the leftover snow from yesterday's blizzard just to do some shopping, especially not on an empty stomach, and it'd be a while past breakfast time even if I did. So I figured I should just work with what I have for now, and that entailed Pop Tarts for breakfast. I popped open the box and pulled out the foil-wrapped snack food. Gardevoir seemed to be intrigued by what I was doing, leaning in close over my shoulder to see what I was doing, so I filled her in on it.

"I'm just preparing some breakfast. It's going to take a few minutes, though," I informed her, as I opened the foil and put the snacks in the toaster. I was prepared to discard the foil, but Gardevoir looked interested in the shiny item.

"Gard?" She was looked at me with a cocked head. I offered the foil to her, since she seemed to want it. She gently took it out of my hand and started playing with it, waving it around and marveling at how the light reflected off of its surface. Now it was my turn to be the observer, as I stood leaning against the countertop looking at her amusement towards the simple snack wrapper. After a couple minutes, the relatively loud springing sound of the toaster broke the tranquil quiet of the room. Gardevoir in particular seemed to be the more shocked of us two, as she dropped the foil and looked towards me as if she was worried about the noise.

"Don't worry, that's just the toaster," I conveyed, even though she likely wasn't sure what that meant either. I grabbed a napkin and took the two Pop Tarts out of the toaster, letting them cool a bit on the same napkin for a moment before walking into the living room and handing them both to Gardevoir.

"Here you go, Gardevoir," I said to her, before sitting down on my couch. She seemed a bit confused by the objects I'd just handed her, so I informed her, "it's food." At this she brightened a little, which reaffirmed my thoughts that she had a decent understanding of simple English, at least in reference to concepts she'd come across in her own life. She wolfed down the first Pop Tart, and I couldn't really blame her. After all, the only thing she'd had yesterday was a quick sandwich I whipped up in the moment, and I had no clue how much she had eaten before then. With this in mind, I got up to go and see about getting something a little more filling (for her and myself), drawing Gardevoir's attention.

"Voir? Gar gar de voir?" I didn't need to know her language to know she wanted to know where I was going.

"I'm looking for something else we can eat," I responded, as I entered the kitchen once more and inspected the contents of the fridge. In my search I found a couple of assorted berries, something I knew many Pokemon would eat on a daily basis, so I grabbed a handful of those and set them on a platter. I followed this up with another pack of Pop Tarts for myself, before leaving the room. The second I walked back into the living room, Gardevoir's eyes lit up. I knew she'd be excited for this. I walked over to the couch and set down the platter on the table right in front of the couch, and then sat down again, beckoning her over to do the same. Gardevoir confusedly came over to me and did as I was doing.

"Garrrrrr..." The moment she sat down, Gardevoir seemed to calm down significantly, not talking, looking around, or anything. I took this moment to chow down on my own pair of Pop Tarts, before sitting up to reach for one of the berries. At this, Gardevoir put her arm over me, keeping me down. At first I was more than a bit confused, but then I saw a cyan aura appear around one of the berries, followed by it gently floating off of the plate and directly towards my right hand. Looks like she didn't to get up from the comfort of the couch, and she didn't want me to have to either. I gently nibbled into the berry, at the amusement of Gardevoir, who had dug into her own. This continued for some time, and before long the only thing left on the platter were berry stems, leaves, and cores, plus the two Pop Tart wrappers. Gardevoir and I, full on berries and Pop Tarts, were simply reclined on the couch, relaxing the morning away. I knew we couldn't spend all day here, though, and began to wonder what else we could do today.
13111211211.title: Staying Toasty

choices: ...still sitting on the couch, glued to the tv.
131112112112.content:
I knew if I didnt shop for groceries soon, I'd regret it. I didnt have much for lunch to share with my new guest and dinner was literally gonna be toaster leavings. I shouldnt have neglected grocery shopping for so long. I only had myself to blame for being forced to brave the storm to achieve the bare necessities. At the very least it wasnt as bad as earlier. It's now mostly rain instead of snow. Hopefully I can rush over and back without drowning!

Gardevoir immediately eyed me the split second I got up out of my seat.
"Gar?!" she questioned me like a frightened housewife.
"I'm gonna go get groceries," I answered her regardless of whether she understood me, "I'll be back."

"Garde!" she hopped up off the couch, still expressing concern.
"It's alright, I wont be long," I tell her even though the words werent filtering in, "I'm just gonna head over to the supermarket and pick up some things and come right back."

"Ga ar de!" Gardevoir followed me as I headed to the door, "Gar de! Vore!"

I sighed and turned back to her, "I'll be back soon. I promise." Didnt look like my statements were clicking with this psychic pokemon. So I had to stop treating her like an adult human and start treating her like a pokemon.
"Here," I went over to the remote and turned on the tv. She immediately jerked her head to the tv screen as soon as it came on.
"TV. Television," I explained and put the remote in her... hand/paw/thing, "you can play with this while I'm gone."
"Gaaaaarrr..." she stated with a bit of added interest (of course, not nearly as much interest as when I squeezed her red-thingy in the shower!) I waved her back down to the couch and despite looking reluctant to, she finally sat back down and focused on the tv screen... though looking back at me one last time just before I stepped out.


I didnt end up getting TOO soaked in the rain, praise Arceus. My clothes were a little wet, but nothing I couldnt handle. Sure my hair got pretty drenched, but that's only because I didnt bring an umbrella. But it was ok. I didnt spend an awful lot of time shopping anyways, I mainly just bought a few microwave dinners, some frozen meats, a couple of drinks, a small bag of pokemon food, and a couple of snacks. That was all. A short line at the checkout and a quick pay with the debit card later, I grabbed my bagged groceries and I was out the door.

"Hi Simon!"

Until I heard HER voice which to those too informed for their own good signaled absolute DOOM.
I paled worse than the rain made me and mouthed 'OH FUCKING HELL' before turning my head to her and smiling, "H-hi Matori! Fancy running into you today!" I almost sounded sarcastic, but it mostly came out kinda off pitch!
The purple haired woman in spectacles smiled sweetly at me despite the familiar looking R logo on her parka filled me with dread.
"Shopping for groceries in this weather?" Matori stopped whatever she was doing to continue chatting, "I hope you bought plenty of cold medicine."
"Eh, I was just getting a few last minute things," I had no choice but to respond, "it aint bad. I dont live that far, anyway."
"Right, you live just up that hill over there, dont you?" I took a heavy breath, hoping to Arceus she doesnt know my address.
"A-a-a little further!"
"And how's your father been doing? Did he ever manage to expand his burger restaurant chain in Aloha?" I feared not only for myself but for dad as well.
"N-Not yet," I answered, "h-he's still finishing up the last few payments of his first restaurant."
"Well I hope you remind him that if he's ever in need of a good loan, you have my card," she reminds me. Like hell I'm gonna put pops in that kind of jeopardy.
"I did," I lied, "but he's really stubborn. He'd rather pay everything off out of his own pocket."

"I see. Anyways, I'm currently running a few errands for work with a couple of associates of mine," Matori explained what she was doing even though I didnt ask her, "on the way, I've been in a bit of a spending mood. Now that the President pass a new tax cut plan, our boss gave us all very generous bonuses." I never thought that HER line of work would even have a tax status to begin with!
"Wow, that's great," I pretended to be excited for her.
"With all that extra money I've made, I bought some gifts. Here, I even bought you something!" she reached into her bag and pulled out an umbrella... An umbrella that bared the logo of Celadon Game Corner... one of her business's fronts! Not only that, she even got me a nice thick warm parka!

"Oh, heh, wow! Thank you!" I eyed the parka, trying to keep my face straight and not looking too suspiciously at the R-insignia engrave on it!
"I had it custom made and tried my best to match your measurements and ensure it fit you right," I pretended not to be a little creeped out by her words, "go ahead try it on!" I swallowed hard and put the parka on, hoping no cops were witnessing me in it (and at the same time hoping cops WERE witnessing it!). It fit perfectly.
"It suits you perfectly," Matori smiled passionately.

"W-well, thank you again for the gifts!" I expressed my gratitude and hoped she didnt take it as flattery. With that, I turned around and headed off.

"By the way!" until Matori zipped in front of me and blocked my path! "Do you happen to have free time tonight? There's going to be a special parade and firework show happening in Jubilife City later." If I was completely oblivious to her occupation and the people she's affiliated with, I probably wouldnt hesitate to go with her! I aint incredibly particular when it comes to a girl asking me out!
But I knew better.

"S-Sorry, Matori," I tried my best to shoot her down easy, "I'm gonna be really busy later."
"Doing what?" she had the decency to question me.
"I've currently got a guest at my place," I answer.
"A guest? An old friend? A relative?" Matori got awfully noisy.
I swallowed and shook my head, "Nah, she's a new neighbor. And I want to make her feel at home. Show her around."
"Ah! Would you like a hand?" she offered, "me and a few associates of mine would be happy to show her around and make her feel at home!" LIKE. FUCKING. HELL.
"TH-THAT'S... ahem! That's right," I almost lost my cool for a second! "I think I got it!"

"Alright, then will you be available tomorrow?" she wasnt about to take no for an answer, "Hearthome City's putting on a concert. I have front row tickets."
"M-Maybe next time," I told her and I walked around her.

"What about next week?" and she zipped in front of me AGAIN! "we can watch this year's Pokemon League Tournament."
"I'm sorry, I really need to get going-"
Then she grabbed my arm. And that look in her spectacle-covered red eyes was chilling!

"I dont understand," she seemed a tad bit cross at me, "you seem to always be busy whenever I ask you to go somewhere with me. Is there some kind of a problem?"
"M-Matori, I honestly didnt mean to offend you if I-"
"Then why do you always keep telling me youre busy? Are you trying to avoid me or something?" crap! Why today of all days?!

It was hopeless. I had to say something. She wasnt gonna let me leave.
"L-l-listen," I explained, "it's not like I'm not interested. I am. I'm very flattered, really." I took a deep breath, "However, I... dont think it's gonna work."
"Why not?" she continued.
"Well... uh... it's not you. It's just... well, I'm not really interested in a relationship. And I know your line of work can be tough on relationships and-"

"Wait." AW CRAP! She gazed at me very suspiciously! I just said the wrong words! "Why do you think my line of work is tough on relationships?"
"Uh... um... w-well..."
"Just what are you implying?" Matori squinted her eyes at me, "what do you think I do for a living?"
"Matori, I'm sorry, it was a bad slip of the tongue-"
"No, answer me," she demanded, "what exactly do you think my line of work is?" I saw through the corner of my eye that she was reaching into her pocket as she asked me. What was in her pocket? A gun? A taser? A syringe? A special prototype pokeball that captures humans?!

"HEY MATORI!!" just then, one of her big bald surly associates called to her from a big black van, "HURRY UP! WE GOTTA GET MOVING!"
Praise Arceus, that was the end of it.
"Sorry, Simon. I have to go," she humbly bowed, "see you around." And headed to the van and it drove off. I facepalmed. I dodged a heck of a bullet, but that wasnt the last of her. I'm so thankful I didnt bring Gardevoir grocery shopping with me!

Even as the rain calmed down, the walk home was incredibly nerve-wrecking. I suddenly remembered why I skipped out on grocery shopping for so long. God, I hope one of Gardevoir's ghost-kisses could perk me back up!

Speaking of which, I headed back to my house and hoped my new guest is fine and didnt cause a ruckus while I was gone. To find out, I opened the door and saw her...
131112112112.title: Aint Prepared For Trouble, Let Alone Double...

choices: ...assured her that I was fine and there was nothing to worry about.
...I didnt need to do anything. She read my mind!
1311121121122.content:

131121.content:
By the time I recognized what she was, she had already woken up. Her big red eyes gazed into me with determination as if not bothered at all by the pain of whoever harmed her. Immediately afterwards, I felt some hostile vibes emitting from her... giving me the suspicion that I probably shouldnt have gotten so close to her!

"Garrr..."

The Gardevoir suddenly grabbed my arm and squeezed it! Just as I wondered what she was up to, my arm began to tingle and shake! Every finger and thumb on that hand was twitching on reflex of their nerves reacting somehow! I wasnt even moving them on my own!
In mere seconds the strange tingles and twitches spread throughout the rest of my body, making me totally lose control of everything below my neck! For a moment, I felt like a marionette with Gardevoir tugging on my strings, making me a do a little dance! Worst moment in the world to remember she's a high-level psychic pokemon! A WILD high-level psychic pokemon!

"Gar de.... voir!"

Even as she let go of my arm, I still couldnt move! I felt some sort of surge of power keeping me frozen stiff! No matter how much I tried, how much my brain tried to tell the rest of my body to move, it wouldnt!

"Hmph," the pokemon merely dusted herself off and circled around me, still gazing into me with intrigue!
Judging by the way she twirled around me effortlessly, she didnt seem wounded! She wasnt hurt at all! I noticed a grin across Gardevoir's mouth as I heard the word 'IDIOT' echo in my head! Damn it, I've been set up!
I couldnt believe I let myself fall victim to such an obvious trap! A professional trainer like myself had just made a Grade A rookie mistake: underestimating an unfamiliar wild pokemon without my partner on standby!

"Arr....let me go!" I demanded, which looking back wasnt a good idea! A high-leveled psychic pokemon could leave quite some nasty mental harm to it's victim. Worst case scenario, they could cause some serious brain damage!

"Gaar.... gar de," I heard her mock me in her own language while I kept hearing 'IDIOT IDIOT IDIOT IDIOT IDIOT' repeat over and over in my mind. "Gard! Gar gar garde! Voir de!" With no other options, I was forced to just stand there in silence and accept her mercy.

"Ga?!" just then, her eyes lowered down to my waist. Sweat dropped down my forehead as that intrigued gaze of hers locked on my belt! She snatched my pokeball holster right off and glared back up at me... like I just made a non-verbal offense. For a wild pokemon, it was a GREAT offense!

"Gardevoir? ....Gardevoir?! GAR-DE-VOIR?!!" she raised her voice angrily at me in her little outrage. Although I couldnt understand her pokemonish language, I knew exactly what she saying.
"Yeah, that's right," I answered,"I'm a pokemon trainer. I capture pokemon."
"Gar-de?!! Gar-de-VOIR!!" she smacked me hard in the chest with my own holster! Thankfully, her psychic spell she put on my body numbed the pain, but it probably left behind a bad rash! She still didnt cool down yet.
Gardevoir chanted something, causing my pokeball holster to glow a darkish aura. Whatever she was about to do wasnt gonna end well form my pokeballs.

"Gaaaaaaaarrr..." my eyes widened when she tossed the glowing holster up in the air...
"What do you think youre-"

"...VOIR!!"
My holster suddenly exploded! All my pokeballs were sent flying all across the forest! The little poke-bitch! I spent a ton of money on those balls and she just scatters them all across the land! Arceus help her if one of those had my Latios in it! I wanted to vent and shout, but I knew better. I didnt want her to leave any mental scars... let alone physical ones!

"Gar?" Gardevoir looked down and noticed one of them was left behind! It mustve fell out when she holster-whipped me! I paled as she bent over and picked it up, still eyeing it with intrigue.

That's when I noticed the little blue 'L' I painted on that pokeball! My Latios pokeball!!

"Whoa hey stop! Put that down!" I pleaded, "please, put it down!"

Gardevoir looked as though she raised an eyebrow at me. Great, now I made her curious!

"Please give it back," I begged her, "I dont care about the others! Just give that one back! That's all I need!"

"Gaaaaaaaaaaaaaaarr..." once again, the damn clever psychic pokemon smirked. She knew I wanted it bad. Did she know WHY I wanted it bad?! I could never live it down if I lost my Latios! Latios was my own and only partner! I... wouldnt say he was a 'friend' or anything like that, more like a devoted teammate! He was loyal, strong, and goshdarn it he'd ALWAYS get the job done! He'd show this psychic bitch a thing or two for messing with me! But he's helpless while he's still in his boss!

"Look! Just give me back the pokeball and I'll walk away," I tried to reason with the pokemon, "you'll never see me again! I swear! HEY! STOP THAT!!" The smug little green monster actually had the gall to start juggling it in front of me! She continued to try my patience, tossing it in the air and catching it with one hand! I'd clench my fists... if I could.

"Gah," Gardevoir finally stopped juggling my pokeball. And then she turned around and walked off... with my damn Latios!!!

"COME BACK!!!" I shouted, but to no avail! The little thief disappeared into the forest with my pokeball! I couldnt believe it. All because I was worried she mightve been hurt! The only voice I heard in my head calling me an idiot was my own! How could I let myself get suckered in by such a poke-conartist?!

Not long after she was gone, the psychic hold she had on my body disappeared as well! I could move again, but it was still long before I could celebrate. Without my Latios, I wouldnt be celebrating ever again!
It was my duty to go after that little manipulative theif and get my pokemon back.

But before I was about to charge in with guns blazing like the reckless idiot that I am, I thought about the situation. What if she WANTED me to follow her?! She could just be leading me into another trap! Maybe I'd get ambushed by her friends or something! Maybe she'd be leading me toward a pack of hungry Ursarings or something equally scary!
Still, I couldnt leave Latios behind. After all those poke-battles he won me, I owed it to him to rescue him!
But just chasing after a high-level intelligent pokemon could just end up getting me more hurt.

What should I do?

"More sleep" you mutter vaguely, eliciting a growl from the figure standing over you. "BLAZIKEN" the figure cries as it rips the mattress out from under you, sending you tumbling to the floor.

"What the hell, Blaziken whats your problem?" "Blazi blaziken" she responded calmly. Dusting yourself off, you rise from the ground. "I'm up, what do you want so badly?"

She held up a bottle of shampoo."Really, a bath? this couldn't have waited another half hour?" she gave you such a pleading look, you couldn't ignore it. "Fine I'll give you a bath." grabbing the bottle you yawn and walk over to the bathroom with Blaziken in tow.

turning on the water you wait for it to adjust to the right temperature, and then let the tub fill. "alright its ready" Blaziken steps in gingerly before sinking into the water with a contented sigh. squeezing some of the shampoo into your palm, you begin to work on her hair.

when you finish with her hair you move on to the rest of her. Working from her shoulders down, you are too preoccupied to notice her shiver at your touch.you get most of her torso, avoiding a few areas. You were about to move on when she grabbed your arms and pulled them back to her chest.

Blushing heavily you try to move your hands but blaziken was far too strong and you couldnt budge an inch. Gently she cooed and moved your arms in a circle looking at you expectantly.

Boooring, why there is no entrainment whatsoever on this train? Between the noise and the complete lack of something to focus on, i am seriously starting to become crazy.

While you keep your left hand occupied holding up you head, gazing in the indefinite distances of..whenever you don't really care at the moment, your right one fall on the pokeball retained in your belt, specifically the one holding up Gina you recently evolved Bayleef.

While the idea of releasing her pass trough your head, you know that it probably be a bad idea, it's well know the grass type and especially the Bayleef/Meganium, are quite....easy, for not saying quite whorish in their ways, especially with their respective trainers.

You sigh, knowing that such things are already, nearly, happened to you as well. You thought about the...bath accident, yeah sure, over and over and finally you reached a satisfying conclusion.

Why not?

In the end she wanted it, and there is no specific law against it, or at least not here, so why not fuck silly your bitchy pokemon? Maybe your morals are keeping you back, could be, or maybe should be, you don't know for sure anymore

The temptation to release her grow, for curiosity if anything, until you hand touch another ball, specifically the one containing Emerald, your Riolu.

Emerald is quite splendid, an excellent exemplar of her species, smart, strong...one thing, while you never met it, you know for sure that her father was a Simisage. A grass type.

Until now she hasn't shown any strange behavior, but you admit that knowing the grass types typical behavior...and nearly ^knowing^ your Bayleef....

A light music echo towards the empty compartment, if anything at least you have your own private cabin for this long voyage: "Attention please, we will reach Hearthome City in three hours, thank you for.." yeah yeah shut it already, you press the blue mute button under the speakers, cutting off the rest of the rubbish.

So another three hours, what i am gonna do?

choices: Blitz joins you in Sparky's hole
14132111.content:
AN: For this story's sake, all Pokemon can speak Human.

You are walking through the woods by Lake Valor one day. You are a novice Pokemon photographer, but you have no Pokemon of your own. Normally, your friend goes with you for protection, but they are busy and nothing has ever really happened before so you decide to go it alone today. As you walk between the lake shore and the tree line, you spot something moving up ahead. You sneak up carefully to investigate.

There is a group of Pokemon consisting of a Buizel, a Dewott, and a Vaporeon. They appear to be ganging up on a Pikachu who is keeping them at bay with jolts of electricity. You pull out your camera to capture the oncoming battle. While you focus the lens, you listen in on what they are saying.

"Alright, Sparky, give us back our Sitrus berries or we'll have to take them back," the Buizel ordered, pounding his fist into his palm.

"But, Blitz, I'm hungry!" the Pikachu replied. "And besides, you guys left them outside. How was I supposed to know they were yours?"

"How about the fact that they were on our log, you thieving rat!" the Vaporeon barked.

"Calm down, Vance," the Buizel, Blitz, told the water eeveelution, "we'll get them back. Otto," he commanded the Dewott, "Go easy on him. We want him to learn never to steal again."

The Dewott nodded and pulled his razor shell off to attack. With lightning speed, Otto launched forward on an aqua jet and slashed Sparky with his shell. The Pikachu fell backwards in pain, but clung to the berries nonetheless.

You moved up to get a better view, but, when you were no more than ten yards away, you tripped on a root and crashed into a pile of sticks and leaves. The sound alerted the Pokemon to your presence and while he left the other two in charge of the Pikachu, the Buizel rushed over to you. You tried to get up and get away, but before you could move, the Buizel had his foot on your neck. He wasn't choking you, yet, but he was letting you know he could. He glared at you in a way that meant: "Go ahead, try something." All you could do was lay there and watch as the other two brought the Pikachu over, knocked out, berries in tow.

"Well, boys, looks like we have to teach two lessons today. Let's get them back to the cave so class can begin."

•••••••••••••••••••••••••

Once you were inside the cave they had dragged you into, the Dewott rolled a rock in front of the entrance to prevent your escape. The cave was still lit by holes in the ceiling letting it sunshine, but you were in the darkest corner. You saw the three water Pokemon coat the Pikachu in mud to damper his electric attacks. When they finished with him, they stripped you of all of your clothes and equipment. You did not fight it because the Dewott held his razor shell to your throat. The Vaporeon woke the Pikachu up and moved him next to you.

"Alright, boys," the Buizel began, "we've got a theif and a spy. Justice will be served, but I'm a fair Pokemon. Let's give these two a chance to explain themselves. Rat?"

The Pikachu refused to answer, instead spitting on the ground.

"Very well, Sparky chooses his right to remain silent. Human?"

"Look, Mr. Buizel—"

"Call me Blitz."

"Okay, Blitz—I'm just a photographer. I was just trying to capture your battle on film. I wasn't spying on you or anything like that!"

"A photographer, huh? Tell me, where would you send those pictures?" Blitz asked.

"Uh, probably to PokeWeek for the Wild Encounters section. Trainers like to know how wild Pokemon battle so they can prepare their own Pokemon."

"Taking pictures to expose a rival's secret's to their enemies...sounds like the definition of 'spying' to me. What do you guys think?" The Dewott and Vaporeon agreed with Blitz. He then assumed a judicial air, "This jury of your peers finds Sparky guilty of grand theft and the Human guilty of malicious espionage. Your punishment will be decided on in an executive session of the Buizel Gang."

The three water types moved over to the door to talk in hushed voices, leaving you with the bitter Pikachu. You don't know what to do, so you try to talk to him. "What kind of punishment do you think they'll give us?"

"Who knows?" Sparky answered. "All three of them are crazy. But Blitz is the craziest. He's got it in his head that he's a dispenser of justice, but all he does is bully everybody equally."

"Well, you did steal from them."

"Ha! Hardly. They purposely leave berries lying out for people to take. Sometimes they let them have them, other times they act like they stole them. I was just unlucky. They're crazy," he repeated.

Just as he finished, Blitz and the others returned. "The Buizel Gang has decided that, as punishment, the two of you will be forced to serve us for a week," he informed them. "Be glad that community service is all you got, as your crimes warranted much more."

"Service?" you ask. "What kind of service?"

"You do whatever we tell you to or Otto here slits your throat," Blitz stated calmly. "Now, for my first order, I want the two of you to entertain us."

"How?" Sparky asks.

"I don't know, do something interesting."

"I can juggle," you offer. Blitz shoots you another death glare. "Sorry."

"How about a battle?" The Vaporeon suggested.

"Vance, that wouldn't be fair to the Human. You know how weak they are. However, that does give me an idea." Blitz grinned mischieviously. "They will fight for dominance."

"What?" you and Sparky say together.

141322111.content:
"Get back here asshole!" you tear through the forest after your friend, Derrick. "You can't catch me Ethan!" "Douche bag!" you roar. The trees tear at your wet t-shirt as you run past. Sleeping peacefully in your hammock, you were woken by a gallon of icy water falling on your head.

As the trees begin to thin out, you notice the cliffside ahead. Derrick avoids it by taking a sharp left turn, which you are unable to copy.

All the rage in your body is replaced by fear as you feel the ground disappear under your feet. Deja-vu strikes you as you hit the cold-waters of Lake Valor. Rising to the surface you see Derrick on the cliff, not twenty feet away, laughing his ass off. "Real funny asshole" you shout from the water. "I'm heading back to camp see you later." he walks off, still laughing.

"That prick" you begin to swim for the shore not noticing the pokemon watching you. "Golduck!" the harsh cry rings in your ears as a blast of water forces you under the waves. You rise to the surface spluttering, only to be forced down again.

As you begin to run out of breath it dawns on you that you might die here. "I don't wanna die. I wanna LIVE!" your thoughts thunder in your head and you swim upwards with almost inhuman speed. When you hit the surface the Golduck fires another blast. Everything seems to be moving in slow motion, you can clearly see the water as it flies towards you.

A simple twist to the left moves you safely out of the way. Moving faster now you dive back into the water and recklessly charge the overgrown duck. Dodging several more blasts you spin and land a solid kick on the duck's beaked face.

"Fuck Yeah! Take that!" the kick seems to have scared the Golduck as it disappears underwater. "F-fuck you golduck" you mumble as you feel all that energy leave you. Try as you might you are unable to keep your eyes open, and faint in the water.
